dialog.line: Hello
Oh joy, it’s you again.
And so it is.
Yes, yes, yes - the wise old one speaks! Last I checked wasn’t I supposed to be the mentor figure in this partnership?
Eh? Who now? Where you say?
Seriously? Just how fossilized are you old timer?
Hehehe
Alright alright! Enough with the outdated sense of humor. Dunno if i can take much more of your ‘lollygagging’
‘Lollygagging’ - not bad young one!
Not how you speak to your elders young man!
I should speak to you any which way I want, less you forget my standing as an immortal master of the written word...
...and yours as a curmudgeonly old interloper!
Charming the youth of today
Bothersome though you are I said I’d help you and what kind of spirit would I be if I didn't live up to my metaphysical word.

dialog.question: Bothersome though you are I said I’d help you and what kind of spirit would I be if I didn't live up to my metaphysical word.

dialog.line: Spirits exist not to keep promises but to demonstrate nature's lessons for good or ill.
And old hermits seem only to exist with the purpose of keeping me from my eternal sleep, but you don't see me complaining!
Very kind of you young man. Where would any of us be without the spirits of this world.
Now there is the respect any well-appointed servant of the afterlife rightly deserves. Thank you kind mortal.
You’d be a spirit that got on my bad side young laddy.
So I suggest you drop the self-satisfied act and get on with helping your elder better one.
Elder yes, better...
Well let’s just say I won't humiliate you by asking how many poetry commendations you've received over your presumably ancient lifetime.
But suffice to say...
I should recoil in awe before your grand overachieving magnificence?
And don't you forget it!
Urgh!
Listen now, if we don't stop that volcano, she’ll bring every brand of anger and malice you’ve ever imagined down upon this elegant landscape...
...not to mention it’s blissfully indifferent inhabitants you worry so much for.
But fear not! I have an idea for how we might take on the issue presently.
Only snag is I need you as my proxy agent in this mortal plane, and for you to be, well, over there.
Um … you’re pointing at the volcano.
Well, to be more precise the mouth of the aforementioned leviathan, but yes - broadly speaking you are correct.

dialog.question: Well, to be more precise the mouth of the aforementioned leviathan, but yes - broadly speaking you are correct.

dialog.line: I understand. All journeys require terminus. Except yours I fear. Eternity cannot be an easy burden to bear.
Wha?! … I’m doing fine thank you very much. Eternity is an honor! And besides, you wouldn’t understand!
No worries my young friend, I have plenty of stories to entertain us for the long journey ahead.
Gods! Thank you but I’ll be quite alright. Thank the heavens I can spirit myeslf away at will.
You mean that distant speck on the horizon, so obscure my eyes strain to discern...
...so far-flung my hamstrings shudder to contemplate!
Yes that one! You know there was a time when folk would fall over each other to help out a spirit in need.
My arthritic joints beg to differ.
Anyways...
Unfortunately for now this river blocks your path.
I have a Haiku that may be of help but strangely enough I need calm waters for such masterful verse to take its effect.
Strange indeed...
I’m afraid you’ll need to figure this one out on your own if we are to proceed.
Besides it’s not a bad bit of Haiku practice for you while I ruminate on larger and more profound concerns.

dialog.question: Besides it’s not a bad bit of Haiku practice for you while I ruminate on larger and more profound concerns.

dialog.line: Hello again
You're back. Lost already are we?
Haikus? You mean the poems!? I’m a little lost…
Your seem to be forgetting things in your old age my decrepit friend. To put it in painfully simple terms for you -
Haikus are poems, but they are also a bridge between man's intellect and the very fabric of the natural world around us.
Using inspiration we find in nature as raw building blocks and juxtaposing those ingredients creatively we can control anything ...
... from the direction of the wind to the colour of the soil, the motion of the stars, to the very inception of animal thought.
Sorry, but you mind explaining again what I'm supposed to be doing?
I should have known I’d end up repeating myself every 5 minutes paired with an old age pensioner like you!
You need to compose a Haiku to calm the waters of the River.
Once the water is calm and the surface still I’ll be able show you some Haiku Mastery that will knock your socks off!
And get you across the river of course.
And how would you suggest I go about composing this Haiku for the river?
Haikus require inspiration from the natural world.
You can collect fragments of such inspiration by simply walking around and writing what you see.
From that you can arrange and compose poetry in your notebook.
When you think you’ve got something good simply read it out to test if it has achieved the desired effect.
Ok then, see you around spirit!
Indeed
